property.description: Property sheet to hold XML specification for forms

formalParameter.description: Configuration Name
IP Address of JBoss AS.
Physical path to jboss-cli.
The configuration name that will be deleted
Provide the absolute physical path of the standalone script, i.e: 'standalone.bat', '/usr/tools/bin/standalone.sh', 'c:/Program Files/JBoss/bin/standalone.bat'. (Required)
Provide the XML config file if you want to start your server with a different configuration.
Supply the configuration name of the JBoss server. This configuration will hold information about the standalone server you want to start. (Required)
Provide the absolute physical path of the domain script, i.e: 'domain.bat', '/usr/tools/bin/domain.sh', 'c:/Program Files/JBoss/bin/domain.bat'. (Required)
Provide the XML config file if you want to start your domain with a different configuration.
Supply the configuration name of the JBoss server. This configuration holds information about the domain you want to start. (Required)

Supply the configuration name of the JBoss server. This configuration holds information about the standalone server you want to shut down. The IP and port are supplied by the configuration. If left blank, default controller values (IP and port) will be used for the shutdown attempt.
Provide the physical location of the admin script, i.e: 'jboss-admin.bat', '/path/to/jboss-admin.sh'.

procedure.description: Deploys the application designated by the war file path or enables an already existing but disabled in the repository deployment designated by the name argument.

formalParameter.description: Supply the configuration name of the JBoss server. This configuration will hold information about the standalone server you want to start.
Path to the application to deploy. Required in case the deployment doesn't exist in the repository. (Required)
Provide the physical location of the admin script, i.e: 'jboss-admin.bat', '/path/to/jboss-admin.sh'.

Unique name of the deployment. If the file path argument is specified, the name argument is optional with the file name been the default value. If the file path argument isn't specified then the command is supposed to enable an already existing but disabled deployment, and in this case the name argument is required.
Provide the runtime name for the deployment.

Select this option to force deployment. If the deployment with the specified name already exists, by default, deployment is aborted and a corresponding message is printed. Switch --force (or -f) forces the replacement of the existing deployment with the one specified in the command arguments.

Select this option to deploy to all available servers. This indicates that deployment applies to all available server groups. Either server-groups or all-server-groups is required in domain mode. This argument is not applicable in standalone mode.

Provide the comma-separated list of server group names the deploy command applies to. Either server-groups or all-server-groups is required in domain mode. This argument is not applicable in standalone mode.

procedure.description: Undeploys a deployment with the given name and, depending on the arguments, removes its content from the repository.

formalParameter.description: Supply the configuration name of the JBoss server. This configuration will hold information about the standalone server you want to start.
Provide the physical location of the admin script, i.e: 'jboss-admin.bat', '/path/to/jboss-admin.sh'.
Unique name of the deployment to undeploy. (Required)
Select this option to disable the deployment and keep the content of the deployment, or unselect it to disable the deployment and removes its content from the repository.

Select this option to apply undeploy to all server groups in which the deployment is enabled. Either server-groups or all-relevant-server-groups is required in domain mode. This argument is not applicable in standalone mode.
Provide the comma-separated list of server group names the undeploy command applies to.

procedure.description: Check the HTTP status of a given URL

formalParameter.description: Supply the configuration name of the JBoss server. This configuration will hold information about the standalone server you want to start.
Provide the physical location of the admin script, i.e: 'jboss-admin.bat', '/path/to/jboss-admin.sh'.

procedure.description: Check the HTTP status of a given URL

formalParameter.description: Supply the configuration name of the JBoss server. This configuration will hold information about the standalone server you want to start.
Provide the physical location of the admin script, i.e: 'jboss-admin.bat', '/path/to/jboss-admin.sh'.
Unique name of the deployment to enable.
Serversgroup.
Servers.

Wait time.
Hosts list.

procedure.description: Enables an already existing but disabled in the repository deployment designated by the name argument. Implemented only for the Standalone Mode.

formalParameter.description: Supply the configuration name of the JBoss server. This configuration will hold information about the standalone server you want to start.
Provide the physical location of the admin script, i.e: 'jboss-admin.bat', '/path/to/jboss-admin.sh'.
Unique name of the deployment to enable.

procedure.description: Disables a deployment designated by the name argument. Implemented only for the Standalone Mode.

formalParameter.description: Supply the configuration name of the JBoss server. This configuration will hold information about the standalone server you want to start.
Provide the physical location of the admin script, i.e: 'jboss-admin.bat', '/path/to/jboss-admin.sh'.
Unique name of the deployment to disable.
Supply the configuration name of the JBoss server. This configuration will hold information about the standalone server you want to start.
Application name.
Profile name for domain mode.
Provide the physical location of the admin script, i.e: 'jboss-admin.bat', '/path/to/jboss-admin.sh'.
The JDBC driver connection URL. i.e., 'jdbc:mysql://localhost:3306/ectest'. (Required)
The fully qualifed name of the JDBC driver class. i.e., 'com.mysql.jdbc.Driver'. (Required)
Specifies the JNDI name for the datasource. This should start with either java:/ or java:jboss/. i.e., 'java:jboss/datasources/MySql'. (Required)

Defines the JDBC driver the datasource should use. This can be either the name of the .jar file or the name of the module, depending on how the driver has been deployed. i.e., 'mysql-connector-java-5.1.20-bin.jar'. (Required)
Specify credential that contains username and password for data source.
Specifies if the datasource should be enabled after creation.
Supply the configuration name of the JBoss server. This configuration will hold information about the standalone server you want to start.
Profile name for domain mode.
Application name.
Provide the physical location of the admin script, i.e: 'jboss-admin.bat', '/path/to/jboss-admin.sh'.
Supply the configuration name of the JBoss server. This configuration will hold information about the standalone server you want to start. (Required)
Provide the physical location of the admin script, i.e: 'jboss-admin.bat', '/path/to/jboss-admin.sh'.
Specifies the command to run.
Supply the configuration name of the JBoss server. This configuration will hold information about the standalone server you want to start. (Required)
Provide the physical location of the admin script, i.e: 'jboss-admin.bat', '/path/to/jboss-admin.sh'.
Specifies the command to run.
Wait time.
Supply the configuration name of the JBoss server. This configuration will hold information about the standalone server you want to start. (Required)
Provide the physical location of the admin script, i.e: 'jboss-admin.bat', '/path/to/jboss-admin.sh'.
Specifies the command to run.
Wait time.
Supply the configuration name of the JBoss server. This configuration will hold information about the standalone server you want to start. (Required)
Provide the physical location of the admin script, i.e: 'jboss-admin.bat', '/path/to/jboss-admin.sh'.
Specifies the command to run.
Specifies the criteria to check.
Wait time.
Supply the configuration name of the JBoss server.
Provide the physical location of the admin script, i.e: 'jboss-admin.bat', '/path/to/jboss-admin.sh'.
Name of the host controller. Information is available at host.xml file. Default is 'master'.
